definitions.definition: A ship designed to break through ice so that it, or other ships coming behind, can navigate on frozen seas .
examples: The steel hulls of ice-breakers are much thicker than those of standard vessels.

definitions.definition: A game , activity , humorous anecdote , etc., designed to ease tension and encourage interaction among individuals in a situation where they do not know each other well.
examples: The new college hallmates were awkward with each other at first, but after a game of charades as an icebreaker , they were laughing like old friends.

definitions.definition: A lively song and dance routine at the start of a musical .

main_definition: ( nautical ) A ship designed to break through ice so that it, or other ships coming behind, can navigate on frozen seas .
secondary_definitions: ( figurative ) A game , activity , humorous anecdote , etc., designed to ease tension and encourage interaction among individuals in a situation where they do not know each other well.
( theater ) A lively song and dance routine at the start of a musical .
